title: BREAKING! Orbex Breaks Ground On UK Mainland's First Vertical Launch Facility
summary: Orbex, a UK-based rocket service provider for small satellites, has begun the construction of the first vertical launch spaceport on the UK mainland, located on the North coast of Scotland.

title: Boeing preparing to ship milestone O3b mPower satellites for launch
summary: The last pair of satellites SES needs to provide upgraded broadband services from medium Earth orbit have completed tests ahead of an early June launch, SES said during financial results May 4.

title: Debate rages about future of New Horizons
summary: NASA and the science team for a spacecraft in the outer reaches of the solar system are locked in a dispute about the future of that mission and the science it can perform.

title: Lockheed Martin announces reorganization of its space business
summary: Lockheed Martin announced May 4 it is consolidating several businesses focused on space into three sectors: Commercial civil space, national security space, and strategic and missile defense.

title: Investing in Space: Viasat launch adds power and flexibility in satellite broadband competition
summary: Viasat took a big step toward satellite staying power last weekend, as the long-awaited launch of the first of the ViaSat-3 trio rumbled off the ground (thanks to the “full power” version of SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy rocket.)

title: Swedish Space Corporation CEO Retires, Replacement Appointed
summary: Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) has announced Charlotta Sund as its new President and CEO. Sund, who will take office in autumn 2023, will replace Stefan Gardefjord, who retires after serving the company for 12 years.

title: SpaceX aces Falcon 9 launch, delivers 56 Starlink satellites to orbit
summary: On a clear night and under a bright Moon, SpaceX launched the Falcon 9 to successfully deliver 56 version 1.5 Starlink satellites...

title: CesiumAstro to supply communications payloads for Space Development Agency satellites
summary: CesiumAstro, a company that specializes in communications technologies for satellites and aircraft, will supply electronic phased-array payloads for seven U.S. military satellites built by Raytheon Technologies.

title: SpaceX readies for a busy month, first up, a Falcon 9 and Starlink satellites
summary: SpaceX is set to begin its potentially busy May launch cadence with the launch of 56 V1.5 Starlink satellites from LC-40 at...

title: Seraphim picks startups for eleventh accelerator program
summary: British early-stage investor Seraphim Space announced May 4 the nine space startups taking part in its latest global accelerator program, which aims to help them raise funds despite a challenging macroeconomic outlook.
